description: The user table is nearly full.

event.Summary: User table is nearly full (Remaining capacity: $v2)

description: Device serial number
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial

description: Number of local users that can still be added before reaching the table limit
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facAuthUsersRemaining

description: The user group table is nearly full.

description: Device serial number
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial

description: Number of user groups that can still be added before reaching the table limit
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facAuthGroupRemaining

description: The Radius NAS table is nearly full.

description: Device serial number

description: Number of Radius NAS that can still be added before reaching the table limit
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facRadiusNasRemaining

description: The Authentication request rate has exceded the configured threshhold.

event.Summary: Authentication request rate for 5 mins ($v2) exceeded the threshold

description: Device serial number
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial

description: Number of authentication events in the last 5 minutes
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facAuthEvents5Mins

description: The Authentication failure rate has exceded the configured threshhold.

event.Summary: Authentication failure rate for 5 mins ($v2) exceeded the threshold

description: Device serial number
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial

description: Number of authentication failures in the last 5 minutes
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facAuthFailures5Mins

description: A user has been locked out for repeated login failures.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facTrapUserLockout FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE FORTINET-CORE-MIB::fnGenTrapMsg s EXAMPLE

description: Device serial number
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: Generic message associated with an event. The content will
depend on the nature of the trap.
variables.name: FORTINET-CORE-MIB::fnGenTrapMsg

description: The FAC device's HA status has changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facTrapHAStatusChange FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facHaCurrentStatus i 1 FORTINET-CORE-MIB::fnGenTrapMsg s EXAMPLE

description: Device serial number
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facSysSerial

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: Instantaneous HA status for this node
variables.name: FORTINET-FORTIAUTHENTICATOR-MIB::facHaCurrentStatus

description: Generic message associated with an event. The content will
depend on the nature of the trap.
